name: electricity production, natural gas, combined cycle power plant | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20780/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity in a combined cycle natural gas power plant Brazil-Northern in 2014.;Comments on the inventory: ;Information about electricity production was obtained in Capacidade Instalada de Geração Elétrica Brasil e Mundo (2014): Ano Referência 2014 and Matrizes Elétricas Estaduais: Ano Referência 2015.;Information about emissions was obtained in COELHO, S. O. (2014).;;MME (2015). Capacidade Instalada de Geração Elétrica Brasil e Mundo (2014): Ano Referência 2014. Edição de 05 de março de 2015. Ministério De Minas E Energia – MME. Secretaria De Planejamento E Desenvolvimento Energético. Núcleo De Estudos Estratégicos De Energia.  ;MME (2016). Matrizes Elétricas Estaduais: Ano Referência 2015. Edição de 23 de novembro de 2016. Ministério De Minas E Energia – MME. Secretaria De Planejamento E Desenvolvimento Energético. Núcleo De Estudos Estratégicos De Energia.;COELHO, S. O. (2014). Avaliação das Emissões Atmosféricas das Principais Termelétricas Brasileiras a Gás Natural – Ano Base 2013. Trabalho Final de Curso apresentado ao Colegiado do Curso de Engenharia Sanitária e Ambiental da Universidade Federal de Juiz de Fora, como requisito parcial à obtenção do título de Engenheiro Sanitarista e Ambiental. UNIVERSIDADE FEDERAL DE JUIZ DE FORA – UFJF. 2014.;The original ecoinvent dataset used as a basis was 'electricity production, natural gas, combined cycle power plant, BR, 2000 - 2015' and it has been copied in '12/2017';[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

From the constructed natural gas power plant ready to produce electricity. 

From reception of natural gas and operating materials at power plant/factory gate

This activity ends with 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and arrived at the busbar. 

This dataset includes:
 - all operation and maintenance activities and materials of the power plants.
 - Cooling: It is a assumed that all plants use wet cooling with a cooling tower.No cooling tower is included in this dataset (will be implemented in future versions)
 - decarbonised water use for reduction of NOx emissions 

This dataset doesn't include 
 - raw materials extraction, decommissioning and waste treatment as these activities are already included in the infrastructure datasets.
 - transformation of the electricity produced.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2014.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
All exchange data were extrapolated from datasets of the following 11 countries: AT, BE, DE, ES, FR, GB, IT, JP, LU, NL, US. The data of those countries basically rely on data of the former UCTE (see general comment). 

The efficiency is based on IEA/OECD statistics and calculated with own assumptions.

The cooling and feed water use has been taken over from datasets for electricity production with hard coal or lignite.

Updated data for regionalization of Brazil (2014-2017):
- Annual Production Volume (specific data)
- Carbon dioxide, fossil (estimated data with US factors (Coelho, 2014))
- Carbon monoxide, fossil (estimated data with US factors (Coelho, 2014))
- Methane, fossil (estimated data with US factors (Coelho, 2014))
- Nitrogen oxides (estimated data with US factors (Coelho, 2014))
- Dinitrogen oxides  (estimated data with US factors (Coelho, 2014))
- Sulfur dioxide  (estimated data with US factors (Coelho, 2014))

dataGenerator.name: Henrique Rogerio Antunes de Souza Junior

dataDocumentor.name: Henrique Rogerio Antunes de Souza Junior

exchanges.description: Amount of power plant infrastructure input calculated based on expected full load hours during power plant lifetime (180000h) and power plant capacity (400MW). See "gas power plant construction, combined cycle, 400MW electrical" dataset and corresponding documentation.

flow.category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

exchanges.description: Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

flow.name: Water
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Mass share of cooling tower needed for producing 1kWh of electricity, based on the burning of 1MJ of natural gas. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and values of 11 countries 
(AT, BE, DE, ES, FR, GB, IT, JP, LU, NL, US) (Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007) 

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: residue from cooling tower
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

defaultProvider.name: market for residue from cooling tower | residue from cooling tower | Cutoff, U
defaultProvider.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity, based on the burning of 1MJ of natural gas. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and emission values of 11 countries 
(AT, BE, DE, ES, FR, GB, IT, JP, LU, NL, US) (Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007) 
Country emissions values estimate from range of values from different references. See Tab. 11.19, p. 138 in Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007.

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: Propane
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: Hexane
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
The data about emissions was obtained in Emissões Atmosféricas das Principais Termelétricas Brasileiras a Gás Natural - Ano Base 2013. (COELHO, 2014) pages 90-101.
In his study the author uses US emissions factors.

total emissions: 7.63 kg
net generation: 884 GWh
plants: TERMONORTE II-RO

The emission values was calculeted by:
annual emissions/(gross_electricity*(1-losses_gross_net))

So adapted to the factor.

COELHO, S. O. (2014). Avaliação das Emissões Atmosféricas das Principais Termelétricas Brasileiras a Gás Natural - Ano Base 2013. Trabalho Final de Curso apresentado ao Colegiado do Curso de Engenharia Sanitária e Ambiental da Universidade Federal de Juiz de Fora, como requisito parcial à obtenção do título de Engenheiro Sanitarista e Ambiental. UNIVERSIDADE FEDERAL DE JUIZ DE FORA - UFJF. 2014.

exchanges.description:
The data about emissions was obtained in Emissões Atmosféricas das Principais Termelétricas Brasileiras a Gás Natural - Ano Base 2013. (COELHO, 2014) pages 90-101.
In his study the author uses US emissions factors.

total emissions: 279,936.96 kg
net generation: 884 GWh
plants: TERMONORTE II-RO

The emission values was calculeted by:
annual emissions/(gross_electricity*(1-losses_gross_net))

So adapted to the factor.

COELHO, S. O. (2014). Avaliação das Emissões Atmosféricas das Principais Termelétricas Brasileiras a Gás Natural - Ano Base 2013. Trabalho Final de Curso apresentado ao Colegiado do Curso de Engenharia Sanitária e Ambiental da Universidade Federal de Juiz de Fora, como requisito parcial à obtenção do título de Engenheiro Sanitarista e Ambiental. UNIVERSIDADE FEDERAL DE JUIZ DE FORA - UFJF. 2014.

flow.name: Methane, fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity, based on the burning of 1MJ of natural gas. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and emission values of 11 countries 
(AT, BE, DE, ES, FR, GB, IT, JP, LU, NL, US) (Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007) 
Country emissions values estimate from range of values from different references. See Tab. 11.19, p. 138 in Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007.

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: Beryllium II
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
The data about emissions was obtained in Emissões Atmosféricas das Principais Termelétricas Brasileiras a Gás Natural - Ano Base 2013. (COELHO, 2014) pages 90-101.
In his study the author uses US emissions factors.

total emissions: 8.66 kg
net generation: 884 GWh
plants: TERMONORTE II-RO

The emission values was calculeted by:
annual emissions/(gross_electricity*(1-losses_gross_net))

So adapted to the factor.

COELHO, S. O. (2014). Avaliação das Emissões Atmosféricas das Principais Termelétricas Brasileiras a Gás Natural - Ano Base 2013. Trabalho Final de Curso apresentado ao Colegiado do Curso de Engenharia Sanitária e Ambiental da Universidade Federal de Juiz de Fora, como requisito parcial à obtenção do título de Engenheiro Sanitarista e Ambiental. UNIVERSIDADE FEDERAL DE JUIZ DE FORA - UFJF. 2014.
